doc.previous: A vertical shear or shear parallel to the axis of lines is similar except that the roles of and are swapped It corresponds to multiplying the coordinate vector by the transposed matrix
doc.after: The vertical shear displaces points to the right of the axis up or down depending on the sign of It leaves vertical lines invariant but tilts all other lines about the point where they meet the axis Horizontal lines in particular get tilted by the shear angle to become lines with slope
